greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) defined by Sum_{k=1..n} T(n,k)*u^k*t^n/n! = ((1+t)*(1+t^2)*(1+t^3)...)^u.
comment: Also the Bell transform of A265024. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 26 2016
formula: T(n; u) = Sum_{k=1..n} T(n, k)*u^k is given by T(n; u) = u * (n-1)! * Sum_{k=1..n} A000593(k)*T(n-k; u)/(n-k)!, T(0; u) = 1. (End)
T(n, k) = (n!/k!) * Sum_{i_1,i_2,...,i_k > 0 and i_1+i_2+...+i_k=n} Product_{j=1..k} A000593(i_j)/i_j. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 09 2020.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := n! SeriesCoefficient[(Times @@ (1 + t^Range[n]))^u, {t, 0, n}, {u, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 04 2019 *)
program: d = lambda n: sum((-1)^(d+1)*n/d for d in divisors(n))
T(n, k) = if(k==0, 0^n, sum(j=0, n-k+1, binomial(n-1, j-1)*a(j)*T(n-j, k-1))) \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 08 2020 after _Peter Luschny_
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 11 2002
